NEW YORK : A federal appeals court said Bank of America Corp was not liable to shareholders for allegedly concealing a US$ 10 billion fraud lawsuit by American International Group Inc , whose filing led to a 20 - percent one - day plunge in the bank 's stock price .

RelatedSentence: The 2nd U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York on Monday found no showing that the bank , Chief Executive Brian Moynihan and other officials had intended to mislead shareholders and acted in a highly unreasonable manner by not disclosing the lawsuit before it was filed .

AIG sued Bank of America on August 8 , 2011 over alleged losses on more than $ 28 billion of mortgage - backed securities that the insurer had bought from the Charlotte , North Carolina - based bank and its Countrywide and Merrill Lynch units .

AIG sued Bank of America on August 8 , 2011 over alleged losses on more than $ 28 billion of mortgage - backed securities that the insurer had bought from the Charlotte , North Carolina - based bank and its Countrywide and Merrill Lynch units .
Major U.S. stock indexes fell more than 5 percent that day , the first trading session after Standard & Poor 's took away the United States ' triple - A credit rating .
